# Privacy Policy

This Privacy Policy describes how SynthFlow collects, uses, and protects your personal information when you use our programming language, tools, and services.

## Overview

SynthFlow is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This policy explains what data we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding your information.

## Information We Collect

### Automatically Collected Information

#### Usage Data
- Feature usage statistics
- Performance metrics
- Error reports
- System configuration information
- Compiler usage patterns

#### Technical Information
- IP addresses
- Browser type and version
- Operating system information
- Device information
- Network connection information

### Information You Provide

#### Account Information
- Name
- Email address
- Profile information
- Payment information (if applicable)

#### Communication Data
- Support requests
- Feedback and suggestions
- Forum posts
- Community contributions

#### Development Data
- Code snippets (when shared)
- Project information
- Debug information
- Performance data

### Information from Third Parties

#### Service Providers
- Hosting providers
- Analytics services
- Payment processors
- Communication platforms

## How We Use Your Information

### To Provide and Improve Our Services
- Compile and run your code
- Provide development tools
- Improve compiler performance
- Fix bugs and issues

### To Communicate With You
- Respond to your inquiries
- Send service notifications
- Provide technical support
- Share product updates

### To Personalize Your Experience
- Customize IDE settings
- Recommend relevant features
- Adapt to your coding style
- Provide contextual help

### To Ensure Security
- Detect and prevent fraud
- Protect against unauthorized access
- Monitor for malicious activity
- Maintain system integrity

### To Comply With Legal Obligations
- Respond to legal requests
- Comply with regulations
- Protect our rights and property
- Enforce our terms of service

## Data Sharing and Disclosure

### With Your Consent
- When you explicitly authorize sharing
- For collaborative features
- When integrating with third-party services
- For community contributions

### With Service Providers
- Hosting and infrastructure providers
- Analytics and monitoring services
- Payment processing partners
- Communication platforms

### For Legal Reasons
- To comply with legal obligations
- To protect our rights and safety
- To prevent fraud and abuse
- To respond to legal requests

### In Connection With Business Transfers
- In the event of a merger or acquisition
- During a business sale or transfer
- As part of corporate restructuring
- In bankruptcy proceedings

## Data Retention

### Active Data
- We retain active user data for as long as your account is active
- Usage data is retained for performance analysis
- Communication data is retained for support purposes
- Development data is retained for service improvement

### Inactive Data
- Inactive accounts are retained for 2 years
- Backup data is retained for 1 year
- Logs are retained for 90 days
- Analytics data is retained for 2 years

### Legal Requirements
- We retain data as required by law
- Financial records are retained for 7 years
- Legal dispute data is retained as needed
- Regulatory compliance data is retained accordingly

## Your Rights and Choices

### Access and Correction
- You can access your personal information
- You can correct inaccurate information
- You can update your account details
- You can review your usage data

### Data Portability
- You can export your data
- You can transfer your data to other services
- You can download your code and projects
- You can request data in standard formats

### Deletion
- You can delete your account
- You can request data deletion
- You can remove specific information
- You can opt out of data collection

### Objection and Restriction
- You can object to data processing
- You can restrict certain data uses
- You can opt out of marketing communications
- You can disable analytics tracking

## Security Measures

### Technical Security
- Encryption of data in transit and at rest
- Secure authentication mechanisms
- Regular security audits
- Vulnerability monitoring

### Organizational Security
- Employee training on privacy
- Access controls and permissions
- Incident response procedures
- Data breach notification processes

### Physical Security
- Secure data center facilities
- Environmental controls
- Physical access restrictions
- Backup and disaster recovery

## Children's Privacy

### Age Requirements
- Our services are not intended for children under 13
- We do not knowingly collect data from children
- Parental consent is required for users under 18
- Special protections for minor users

### Parental Rights
- Parents can access their children's data
- Parents can request deletion of children's data
- Parents can manage children's accounts
- Parents can control privacy settings

## International Data Transfers

### Global Operations
- We operate globally
- Data may be transferred internationally
- We comply with transfer restrictions
- We use standard contractual clauses

### Data Protection Levels
- We ensure adequate protection levels
- We implement supplementary measures
- We monitor legal developments
- We adapt to changing requirements

## Third-Party Services

### Integrated Services
- We integrate with third-party tools
- We link to external services
- We use third-party APIs
- We partner with service providers

### Responsibility
- Third parties have their own privacy policies
- We are not responsible for third-party practices
- We vet third-party security measures
- We monitor third-party compliance

## Changes to This Policy

### Update Process
- We may update this policy periodically
- We notify users of significant changes
- We provide effective dates for updates
- We maintain historical versions

### Notification Methods
- Email notifications
- In-product notifications
- Website announcements
- Blog posts and documentation

## Contact Information

### Privacy Questions
If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at:

Privacy Officer
SynthFlow Project
Email: privacy@synthflow.ai

### Data Protection Authority
For EU residents, you have the right to complain to your local data protection authority.

### Support
For account-specific privacy questions, please contact our support team at:

Support Team
Email: support@synthflow.ai

## California Privacy Rights

### CCPA Compliance
California residents have additional rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act:

- Right to know what personal information is collected
- Right to delete personal information
- Right to opt out of sale of personal information
- Right to non-discrimination for exercising privacy rights

### Requests
California residents can submit requests to:

Privacy Rights
Email: privacy-rights@synthflow.ai

## European Privacy Rights

### GDPR Compliance
European residents have additional rights under the General Data Protection Regulation:

- Right to access personal data
- Right to rectification
- Right to erasure
- Right to restrict processing
- Right to data portability
- Right to object
- Rights related to automated decision-making

### Requests
European residents can submit requests to:

GDPR Compliance
Email: gdpr@synthflow.ai

## Cookies and Tracking Technologies

### Types of Cookies
- Essential cookies for service functionality
- Performance cookies for analytics
- Functional cookies for preferences
- Advertising cookies (if applicable)

### Cookie Management
- You can manage cookie preferences
- You can disable non-essential cookies
- You can clear cookies from your browser
- You can use cookie blocking tools

## Analytics and Monitoring

### Usage Analytics
- We use analytics to improve our services
- We monitor performance and reliability
- We track feature adoption
- We measure user satisfaction

### Opt-Out Options
- You can opt out of analytics collection
- You can use do-not-track browser settings
- You can install opt-out browser extensions
- You can disable analytics in settings

## Marketing Communications

### Newsletter
- We send periodic newsletters
- You can subscribe to updates
- You can unsubscribe at any time
- We provide clear unsubscribe links

### Promotional Emails
- We may send promotional offers
- You can opt out of marketing emails
- We segment based on user interests
- We personalize content appropriately

## Data Breach Notification

### Incident Response
- We have a data breach response plan
- We notify affected users promptly
- We work with authorities as required
- We take steps to prevent future breaches

### Notification Process
- We provide details of the breach
- We explain the potential impact
- We describe protective measures
- We offer support and resources

This Privacy Policy was last updated on November 24, 2025. We encourage you to review this policy periodically for any changes.
